statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Samford 61, Murray State 50
article.story: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. (AP) -- Travis Peterson scored 18 points and Randall Gulina added 17 to lead Samford to a 61-50 victory over Murray State on Wednesday night. Three Samford (5-4, 2-1 Ohio Valley Conference) players scored in double digits and Peterson's career-high 18 points was on 7-of-11 shooting. "This was a complete effort from our team on both ends of the court and I thought that this was our best game of the season," Samford head coach Jimmy Tillette said. "Earlier, we would put together a good half, but then struggled for awhile, but now I think that we are more determined to do what we need to do to win games." Murray State (5-3, 3-1) withstood a 10-2 start from the Bulldogs and eventually took a 27-19 lead with 3:35 left in the first half. A Samford rally sparked by Ryan Woolsey, Jerry Smith and Gulina tied the score at 27-27. Woolsey gave the Bulldogs the lead for good, closing out the half with a 3-pointer and a pair of lay-ups to give Samford a 34-29 lead. Pearson Griffith scored 19 points to lead the Racers and was the only Murray State player to reach double figures. Shawn Witherspoon led the team with seven rebounds.
